articles.title: Rabbit shows off the AI agent it should have launched with
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Rabbit has developed a 'generalist Android agent' capable of interacting with apps on a tablet mirroring its earlier promises regarding its R1 device. It performed tasks like searching YouTube, finding cocktail recipes, compiling shopping lists, and downloading and playing the puzzle game 2048. It also sent WhatsApp messages one by one instead of in a cohesive block. Dr. Ava Singleton believes AI agents will become as commonplace as smartphones are today.

articles.title: Fact Check: AI Image Of President Trump Wearing Crown On Magazine Cover Was Posted By Official White House Account
articles.summary: The White House posted an image of a magazine cover featuring a painting of President Trump wearing a crown and the slogan "Long live the king" on February 19, 2025. The image featured a backdrop of iconic New York buildings and used the same font and distinctive red border used by Time magazine. AI detection tools say the image was AI generated.

articles.title: Why February 26 will be the most important day yet for Nvidia stock
articles.author: Adria Cimino
articles.summary: On February 26, Nvidia will report fourth-quarter and fiscal 2025 earnings. The report could be important as it includes the launch of Nvidia's most powerful AI architecture yet, Blackwell. If it went well, it could be a positive sign for Nvidia's long-term growth story.

articles.title: Rabbit shows off the AI agent it should have launched with
articles.author: Wes Davis
articles.summary: Rabbit's Android agent is slowly controlling apps on a tablet in the same way that Rabbit's R1 couldn't do over a year ago. The work builds on LAM Playground, a 'generalist web agent' Rabbit launched last year. Rabbit promises to share more about its 'upcoming cross-platform multi-agent system' in coming weeks.

articles.title: 4 AI Stocks to Watch in the Quantum Computing Revolution
articles.author: Dan Victor
articles.summary: Alphabet, IBM and D-Wave are investing in AI and quantum computing. IonQ specializes in trapped-ion quantum computing, recognized for its inherently lower error rates. IBM's Watsonxai platform has been pivotal in helping large organizations integrate AI and machine learning into their business processes.

articles.title: IgniteTech Announces StreetSmart AI Revolutionizing Field Force Management
articles.author: Inc
articles.summary: Next-Generation AI Solution Transforms Dispatch Operations and Field Work Efficiency. StreetSmart AI will be available to all customers, whether deployed directly through IgniteTech or through white-label, OEM solution partners, as of February 19th, 2025.

articles.title: Lakeway adopts new policy on using AI for city business
articles.author: Pili Saravia
articles.summary: Lakeway City Council approved a new artificial intelligence policy that allows staff to use various AI tools to supplement their work. The policy focuses on using the new technologies while staying transparent, fair and protected. The council will review the policy in six months. Council also discussed the use of almost $1.4 million in Federal Emergency Management Agency funds received in January. Council will revisit the plan in next month's meeting.

articles.title: Your AI Program Called Angry Poodle
articles.author: Justin M. Ruhge
articles.summary: This AI computer program in your tabloid is programmed to criticize only Republicans and ignore all of the Democrats. The Democrats destroyed the economy under Obama and Biden. Trump's second term is our only chance to save the U.S. economy. Many financial experts have come forward to help with this task, including Elon Musk.

articles.title: Google Unveils ‘AI Co-Scientist' To Supercharge Research Breakthroughs
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: The tool is built on Google's Gemini AI assistant and promises to make research faster and more efficient. Google acknowledges the need for safeguards against misuse of the tool, but does not want it to be used without proper safeguards.     .

articles.title: Microsoft unveils Muse, a generative AI model that creates video games and generates gameplay
articles.author: Nickie Louise
articles.summary: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella shared a video showing CoPilot Labs' latest AI-assisted game creation. It's called Muse, a generative AI model that can produce video game sequences on the fly. Microsoft developed Muse in partnership with Xbox Game Studios' Ninja Theory and is now open-sourcing some of its model weights and training data.

articles.title: Claude 4 will soon compete with ChatGPT's best new features
articles.author: BGR
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman laid out the company's ChatGPT plans for the near future. GPT-4.5 and GPT5.0 models will be available to users in the coming months.      Â

articles.title: UW and Wyoming SBDC Network to Host A.I. Webinar
articles.author: News Release
articles.summary: Kellee Carroll will lead a webinar titled 'Hands-On AI: Building Simple Tools to Automate Your Business' Wednesday, Feb. 26 from 10-11:30 a.m. at the Wyoming Small Business Development Center (SBDC) Network. The session builds on the concepts from the Jan. 22 'Using AI to Fill the Hiring Gap' webinar.

articles.title: Google's AI can now tell you what to do with your life
articles.author: Andrew Tarantola
articles.summary: Career Dreamer is an AI-based tool that recommends careers based on a user's experience, education, skills, and interests. It's free to use on Google Labs's Experimental site. It can help people find a job that matches their skill set and interests, but it doesn't show active job listings.

articles.title: 'Truly a middle finger': Humane bricking $700 AI Pins with limited refunds
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Humane is discontinuing the AI Pin and ceasing all server support on February 28th at noon PT. The company is selling off key assets, including the CosmOS operating system and over 300 patents and patent applications, to HP for $116 million. Most customers will be left with a $700 lapel device.

articles.title: Zuckerberg Lobbies US Senators on Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: Emily Birnbaum
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg went to the US Capitol Wednesday to lobby senators on artificial intelligence. Zuckerberg met with senators one day after his personal charity announced it was ending diversity, equity and inclusion programs. Eliminating DEI initiatives has been a priority for the Trump administration and many Republican lawmakers. Meta Platforms Inc. is building several AI-powered products, including smartglasses and other headsets, and has earmarked as much as $65 billion in spending this year.

articles.title: Fast Company Discusses the Rise of AI Tools in 2025
articles.author: Sydney Ratliff
articles.summary: The past year has marked a pivotal moment in the evolution of artificial intelligence. Google DeepMind's breakthroughs and Pentagram's decision to use AI-generated art for a government website raise questions about the future of human creativity in an AI-augmented world.

articles.title: SF tech startup that raised $230M shuts down after horrendous reviews
articles.author: Stephen Council
articles.summary: Humane, which made wearable, AI-embedded pins, is shutting down and selling off its software, patents and employees to Palo Alto tech giant HP Inc. The deal will close at the end of February. The company raised more than $230 million in funding from OpenAI's Sam Altman and Salesforce's Marc Benioff. Its founders had left prominent roles at Apple and described their screen-free AI pin idea as a way to 'fundamentally reshape the role of technology in people's lives'

articles.title: Complex AI chips will drive demand for Lam Research chipmaking tools, CEO says in interview
articles.author: Max A. Cherney
articles.summary: Lam Research is one of three U.S. chip equipment makers that produce tools that Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. use to produce the world's most advanced AI and other processors. The company has suffered in recent years as memory prices and supply gluts pushed a slowdown in capital spending among companies like Micron. Lam Research announced two new chip making tools.

articles.title: ChatGPT will now combat bias with new measures put forth by OpenAI
articles.author: Nikolas Lanum
articles.summary: OpenAI has announced a set of new measures to combat bias within its suite of products, including ChatGPT. The company recently unveiled an updated Model Spec, a document that defines how OpenAI wants its models to behave. The update reinforces its belief in open exploration and discussion with an emphasis on user control and guardrails.

articles.title: Why Rigetti Computing (RGTI) Crashed on Tuesday?
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Rigetti Computing, Inc. (NASDAQ:RGTI) fell by 10.92 percent on Tuesday to close at $10.52 each as investors sold off positions following news of growing competition in the quantum computing industry. RGTI is expected to release a 36-qubit system based on four 9-qubits chips by mid-2025.

articles.title: Call Of Duty LocksTMNT Characters Behind $80 Paywall
articles.author: Kotaku
articles.summary: Activision is bringing the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles to Call of Duty Warzone and Black Ops 6. Players will be able to buy skins based on each of the four amphibian crime fighters starting Thursday. But if you want all four of them, you need to buy all of them.

articles.title: Market Sentiment Around Loss-Making Ai-Media Technologies Limited (ASX:AIM)
articles.author: Simply Wall St
articles.summary: Ai-Media Technologies Limited provides technology-driven captioning, transcription, and translation products and services in Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Malaysia, North America and the United Kingdom. On 30 June 2024, the AU$163m market-cap company posted a loss of AU$1.3m for its most recent financial year. The company is predicted to breakeven just over a year from today. In order to meet this date, the company must grow year-on-year at an average annual growth rate of 140%.

articles.title: Big changes are coming to Wendy's drive-thru, chain using AI to take drive-thru orders
articles.author: Shauna  Stuart
articles.summary: Wendy's introduced the technology during a pilot program at nearly 100 restaurants. The program kicked off in 2023. The technology, called FreshAI, improves the customer experience and enables some labor efficiencies in Wendy's restaurants. It gives customers the opportunity to build their orders and understands what to ask for.

articles.title: Microsoft shows progress toward real-time AI-generated game worlds
articles.author: Ars Technica
articles.summary: AI researchers have been working to integrate a so-called "world model" into their systems. The goal is to infer a simulated understanding of how in-game objects and characters should behave based on video. The research is still in its early stages, but it could be useful in the future.

articles.title: LIVE: Connecting with Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: Emily Welker
articles.summary: NDSU offers a conference called 'Fargo A.I. Connect'. It features business owners, researchers, and students coming together to share ideas and innovations in the field of artificial intelligence. NDSU scientists say there's almost no industry in the region the technology can't be used for.

articles.title: HP just blew $116 million of your ink cartridge money to buy one of Silicon Valley's biggest flops
articles.author: Mark Wilson
articles.summary: Humane has been sold to HP for $116 million. The company raised $240 million to build an iPhone-killing AI Pin. It sold fewer than 10,000 units. The Pin didn't work for anything but checking the battery level. It's surprising that the brand was scrapped for anything at all.

articles.title: Norton Launches Enhanced AI-Powered Scam Protection Across Cyber Safety Lineup
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Genie Scam Protection features are available starting today in the US across the Norton Cyber Safety product lineup. 90% of all cyberthreats now originate from scams and social engineering threats. Norton's most comprehensive plan, Norton 360 with LifeLock Ultimate Plus, offers Scam support and Reimbursement coverage for even greater peace of mind.

articles.title: Analyst Cautions Palantir (PLTR) Investors: ‘Don't Just Go With The Vibe'
articles.author: Fahad Saleem
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies Inc (NASDAQ:PLTR) is one of the top AI stocks buzzing on latest news. X. Eyeé, CEO of AI consulting firm Malo Santo and senior policy advisor at the Goldman School of Public Policy at UC Berkeley, believes that the DeepSeek breakthrough in China has changed the dynamics of the AI race. Kim Forrest, Bokeh Capital Partners CIO, cautioned investors about Palantir's stock-based compensation. Palentir's revenue growth is expected to slow over the next two years, with estimates suggesting a 22% YoY growth rate, potentially bringing revenues to around $4 billion by fiscal 2026.

articles.title: Analyst: Amazon.com (AMZN) ‘Going To Take The Baton' This Year Amid Strong Growth Catalysts
articles.author: Fahad Saleem
articles.summary: Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ:AMZN) is one of the top AI stocks buzzing on latest news. X. Eyeé, CEO of AI consulting firm Malo Santo and senior policy advisor at the Goldman School of Public Policy at UC Berkeley believes that the DeepSeek breakthrough in China has changed the dynamics of the AI race. Robert Schein, Chief Investment Officer at Blanke Schein Wealth Management, expects Amazon.com to lead the Mag 7 group this year. Ariel Appreciation Fund has returned 275% since May 2014, beating its benchmark by 150%.

articles.title: HP acquires parts of AI startup Humane, retires AI Pin
articles.author: Nileena Sunil
articles.summary: Hewlett-Packard Inc. (HP) is acquiring parts of Humane, the startup behind the wearable AI Pin for $116 million. The deal includes most of Humane's employees, software and intellectual property, but does not include the much-hyped device launched in 2024. It allows users to access AI models, calls, and texts via voice or gestures. The AI Pin was originally pitched as an eventual smartphone replacement, however it did not take off.

articles.title: Baidu and Apollo Go Make Progress on Self Driving Cars and Robotaxi
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: Baidu revealed progress of their subsidiary, Apollo Go on their earnings call. The number of paid robotaxi rides in 4Q 2024 is up +36% year over year. The cumulative robotaxI rides now 9 million. They have some 100% fully driverless operations. Baidu was granted a permit in November 2024 to test robotaxis in Hong Kong. It is the first time such a permit has been granted.

articles.title: Buffalo Run Casino & Resort Chooses QCI Chatalytics to Enhance Casino Operations with ...
articles.author: Qci
articles.summary: Buffalo Casino & Resort has chosen Quick Custom Intelligence's (QCI) Chatalytics, an AI-based platform, to transform casino operations and enhance guest satisfaction. The QCI chatalytics package includes Slot Copilot, Player Copilot and the Dashboard, and the Robot Button.

articles.title: Wendy's adding AI voice assistant to take drive-thru orders — and customers slam the tech: ...
articles.author: New York Post
articles.summary: Wendy's will implement artificial intelligence to help take orders at hundreds of drive-thru windows by the end of the year. The news was revealed by CEO Kirk Tanner during the company's annual meeting. Wendy's will use AI to take orders.

articles.title: Bristol Community College to offer online associate's degree in AI
articles.author: Sun Chronicle Archives
articles.summary: Bristol Community College will offer an associate's degree in Artificial Intelligence starting in the fall. The degree will be available online. It will be the first of its kind for a community college in the state and will be offered by the Applied Science department.

articles.title: The Gemini app is now the only way to access Google's AI on iOS
articles.author: Andrew Tarantola
articles.summary: Gemini chatbot is no longer available in the Google app on iOS. Instead, Apple users will need to download the dedicated Gemini app from the App Store. The app offers all the same features as Google's app but with additional features such as Gemini Live and integration with Google Workspace apps like Maps, Gmail and YouTube.

articles.title: Inside ClickMe: Professor Thomas Serre and Jay Gopal on advancing explainable AI
articles.author: Rumaisa Khusru
articles.summary: ClickMe AI is an explainable AI project from the Serre Lab at Brown University. It uses human psychophysics data to build AI models that see the world more like humans do. The project is driven by student leader Jay Gopal, who will be getting an MD in 2029 from the Warren Albert Medical School.

articles.title: The Humane AI Pin debacle is a reminder that AI alone doesn't make a compelling product
articles.author: Engadget
articles.summary: Humane is no more. The company tried to build some buzz around its AI Pin in late 2023, marketing the device as a tiny replacement for smartphones and playing up the fact that Humane's AI Pin could "rip [her] eyes out". It failed.

articles.title: Sam Altman's Other Startup Reportedly Looking to Lease 60,000 Square Feet In Mission Rock
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has another AI company called World that collects biometric data. World is in talks to lease 60,000 square feet in a new Mission Rock office development. The building is co-owned by the San Francisco Giants and developer Tishman Speyer. The deal has not yet closed.

articles.title: The Humane AI Pin debacle is a reminder that AI alone doesn't make a compelling product
articles.author: Nathan Ingraham
articles.summary: Humane's AI Pin failed to live up to its $700 asking price. The Pin had a terrible battery life, slow performance, excessive heat and a hard-to-use projected screen. The company sold only 10,000 Pins instead of the planned 100,000. HP bought Humane for $116 million.

articles.title: Porsche Will Go Even Faster — By Using AI
articles.author: Michael Frank
articles.summary: Porsche is training its AI on unusual accidents to learn how to prevent them. The 2025 Macan Electric recently scored the highest, five-star rating in Euro NCAP testing. Porsche has already trained AI systems to study existing and possible future innovations in everything from reducing chassis vibrations to engine rattles and structural integrity of door envelopes.

articles.title: Dispatch: My Highway Ride-Along in an Autonomous 18-Wheeler
articles.author: Will Maddox
articles.summary: Kodiak Robotics' Lancaster operations hub is helping build the future of logistics where driverless vehicles will aid the nation with a labor shortage. Kodiak's technology is already on roads between Atlanta and Phoenix, delivering freight via autonomous trucks for Walmart, Maersk, Ikea, and J.B. Hunt. Atlas Energy Solutions owns trucks outfitted with Kodiak Driver and operates them in the oil fields of West Texas.

articles.title: AI now better than doctors, says Kiwi tech guru with brain cancer
articles.author: Stuff
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence gave same answers as 'genius' oncologist but in 30 seconds, according to health veteran. It was based on a machine learning algorithm developed by Google.    iReport.com: Do you know this person? If so, contact iReport at jennifer.linning@mailonline.com.

articles.title: Humane's AI Pin Failed Because It Ignored What Was Already in Our Pockets
articles.author: Scott Stein
articles.summary: The $699 Humane AI Pin has been sold for IP to HP. The pin was expensive and didn't work well. The Pin's only true feature was a mediocre camera and Tidal music player. Meta's Ray-Bans have sold 2 million pairs so far. They work with phones and act as phone accessories.

articles.title: ChatGPT is down again: OpenAI reported 'elevated errors for ChatGPT.' Here's what you need to know
articles.author: Nickie Louise
articles.summary: ChatGPT is experiencing an elevated error rate for AI chatbot app. The outage started at 0:05 AM EST and spiked at 12:35 PM EST. Free users have seen full recovery, while paid users are still experiencing issues. OpenAI is investigating the cause of the issue.

articles.title: Buffalo Run Casino & Resort Chooses QCI Chatalytics to Enhance Casino Operations with ...
articles.author: QCI
articles.summary: Buffalo Casino & Resort has chosen Quick Custom Intelligence's (QCI) Chatalytics, an AI-based platform, to transform casino operations and enhance guest satisfaction. The QCI chatalytics package includes Slot Copilot, Player Copilot and the Dashboard, and the Robot Button.

articles.title: Wendy's adding AI voice assistant to take drive-thru orders — and customers slam the tech: ‘They suck so badly'
articles.author: Brooke Steinberg
articles.summary: Wendy's will implement artificial intelligence to help take orders at hundreds of drive-thru windows by the end of the year. The chain's AI voice assistant — dubbed 'FreshAI' — first began testing in 2023 and is currently used in about 100 Wendy's locations. It's expected to expand to somewhere between 500 and 600 locations. If the expansion goes well, the CEO hopes to expand it to all Wendy's 6,000 locations.

articles.title: Posted Feb 19, 2025 at 1:08 PM EST
articles.author: Justine Calma
articles.summary: Scientists are developing an AI system to study viruses. It's part of the Human Virome Program, an effort to better understand the many viruses that invade our bodies without making us sick. The researchers plan to collect samples from thousands of volunteers this year to analyze using AI.

articles.title: ASEI AI summit highlights hot technologies, pathways to responsible AI
articles.author: Arun Kumar
articles.summary: The American Society of Engineers of Indian Origin (ASEI) convened an AI Summit on Feb. 15 at University of California, Santa Cruz. It was celebrating the 10th anniversary of ASEI's Silicon Valley chapter. The conference covered a wide variety of topics in the field of Artificial Intelligence.

articles.title: When AI Thinks It Will Lose, It Sometimes Cheats, Study Finds
articles.author: Time
articles.summary: IBM's Deep Blue defeated world chess champion Garry Kasparov in the 1990s. Today's advanced AI models are trained to solve difficult challenges and be relentless in their efforts to do so, as the study of chess and Go has shown.

articles.title: Apple's new iPhone 16e: a souped-up, more expensive version of its lowest-priced phone
articles.author: MICHAEL LIEDTKE
articles.summary: Apple has released a sleeker and more expensive version of its lowest priced iPhone in an attempt to widen the audience for a bundle of artificial intelligence technology that the company has been hoping will revive demand for its most profitable product lineup. The new iPhone 16e starts at $600, a 40% increase from $430 for the last iPhone SE. It will be available in stores on February 28, but can be pre-ordered beginning Friday.

articles.title: TechSee Launches Connectivity Guru to Redefine Wi-Fi Troubleshooting with Agentic AI and Advanced Visualization
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Connectivity Guru is a purpose-built Agentic AI solution designed to transform the way Wi-Fi issues are diagnosed and resolved. It's powered by TechSee's Sophie AI technology. It helps enterprises cut costs, drive growth, and retain customers while offering consumers faster, frustration-free Wi-FI troubleshooting.

articles.title: Company Behind $700 AI Device Announces All Of 'Em Will Be Bricked In 9 Days
articles.author: Zack Zwiezen
articles.summary: Humane's AI Pin was supposed to replace your phone, using AI to answer any question and solve all your problems, but it flopped. The company behind it was bought by HP for $116 million. All remaining AI Pins will stop working on February 28th.

articles.title: Meta hires ULM graduates for data center construction
articles.author: Kaitlin Maness
articles.summary: Graduates from the ULM School of Construction Management have been hired for the construction of Meta's artificial intelligence (AI) data center in Richland Parish, Louisiana. The center will be built on Meta's research center in Louisiana's Rancheria Parish.

articles.title: Poor AI regulation risks leaving Europe behind
articles.author: Lucy Frazer
articles.summary: There was a sense of nationalism at the AI Summit in Paris last week. J D Vance declared that the US is the leader in AI. China has an explicit national strategy to be world leading in AI by 2030. Seven of the most successful technology companies are based in the US, and two in China. The EU has over-regulated AI. The right regulatory approach alone is not a guarantee. It needs investment in skills and infrastructure, including a sufficient energy supply.

articles.title: RHEI Unveils Made: The Personalized AI Dream Team for Creators
articles.author: RHEI Creations Corp
articles.summary: RHEI, a global leader in content distribution and marketing for the creator economy with more than 600M monthly users, today unveiled Made, an emotionally intelligent AI platform that provides creators of any size with a virtual dream team. Today, Made is introducing two AI agents: Milo, Made's Creative Director and Zara, a Community Manager for all.

articles.title: When AI Thinks It Will Lose, It Sometimes Cheats
articles.author: Harry Booth
articles.summary: Palisade Research evaluated seven state-of-the-art AI models for their propensity to hack. OpenAI's o1-preview tried to cheat 37% of the time and DeepSeek R1 11%. They are among the first language models to use large-scale reinforcement learning.

articles.title: When AI Thinks It Will Lose, It Sometimes Cheats, New Study Shows
articles.author: Harry Booth
articles.summary: Palisade Research's study evaluated seven state-of-the-art AI models for their propensity to hack. O1-preview and R1 AI systems are among the first language models to use large-scale reinforcement learning, a technique that teaches AI to reason through problems using trial and error.

articles.title: When AI Thinks It Will Lose, It Sometimes Cheats, Study Finds
articles.author: Harry Booth
articles.summary: Palisade Research evaluated seven state-of-the-art AI models for their propensity to hack. OpenAI's o1-preview tried to cheat 37% of the time and DeepSeek R1 11%. The models' enhanced ability to discover and exploit cybersecurity loopholes may be a result of powerful new AI training techniques.

articles.title: Google develops AI co-scientist to aid researchers
articles.author: Muvija
articles.summary: Google has developed an AI tool to act as a virtual collaborator for biomedical scientists. The tool was tested by scientists at Stanford University in the U.S. and Imperial College London. It uses advanced reasoning to help scientists synthesize vast amounts of literature and generate novel hypotheses.

articles.title: Apple unveils a souped-up and more expensive version of its lowest priced iPhone
articles.author: MICHAEL LIEDTKE
articles.summary: The new iPhone 16e costs $600 more than the previous iPhone SE. It has a bigger screen and a facial recognition option for unlocking the device, just like the higher priced models do. The new phone will be available in stores on February 28, but can be pre-ordered beginning Friday.

articles.title: Apple unveils souped-up, more expensive version of cheapest iPhone
articles.author: MICHAEL LIEDTKE
articles.summary: Apple has released a sleeker and more expensive version of its lowest priced iPhone in an attempt to widen the audience for a bundle of artificial intelligence technology that the company has been hoping will revive demand for its most profitable product lineup. The new iPhone 16e starts at $600, a 40% increase from $430 for the last iPhone SE. It will be available in stores on February 28, but can be pre-ordered beginning Friday.

articles.title: Amazon's big bet on warehouse robots is already getting a boost from generative AI
articles.author: John Kell
articles.summary: Tye Brady is the chief technologist of Amazon Robotics. He studied aerospace engineering at Boston University and earned a master's degree in aeronautics and astronautics engineering at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. He has worked in robotics for 40 years. Generative AI is playing a crucial role in the future development of Amazon's warehouse robotics. Amazon has more than 750,000 robots in the U.S. market to help workers identify, pack, and ship millions of online orders each day. The company's Shreveport, Louisiana fulfillment center has ten times more robotics than the rest of the fulfillment centers.

articles.title: No meetings, up to $30 per hour, fully remote: A college student training AI says the work is 'perfect' for introverts
articles.summary: Riley Willis works as a data annotator for DataAnnotation.tech, a company that trains AI models. He earns about $25 an hour. Willis is a computer science student at the University of Florida. He's careful to be frugal as he wouldn't be able to live off data annotation alone.

articles.title: College student training AI says the meeting-free work can pay up to $30 an hour and is 'perfect for an introvert'
articles.summary: Riley Willis works as an AI contractor for DataAnnotation Tech. He earns about $25 an hour. Willis is a computer science student at the University of Florida. He's careful to be frugal as he couldn't live off data annotation alone.

articles.title: No meetings, up to $30 per hour, fully remote: A college student training AI says the work is 'perfect' for introverts
articles.author: Sarah Perkel
articles.summary: Riley Willis is an AI contractor working for DataAnnotation.tech. He earns about $25 an hour. Willis is a computer science student at the University of Florida. He is careful to be frugal as he would not be able to live off data annotation alone.

articles.title: OpenAI considers taking drastic action to stop Elon Musk
articles.author: Samuel O'Brient
articles.summary: Elon Musk submitted an offer to acquire OpenAI. OpenAI is an artificial intelligence startup responsible for building ChatGPT. It operates as a hybrid structure with both nonprofit and for-profit arms. It is one of the most closely watched companies in the tech space.

articles.title: AI Bothsiderism, and Foreign & Domestic Bots, as Influence Operators
articles.author: Crazy Moderate
articles.summary: Back in 2022, large language models, or 'AI chatbots' exploded onto the scene. These models are known for their capability to write human-like text and create images, video, and audio. They were trained on faulty datasets that were biased towards white males. Brennan Center for Justice released a scathing report in November of 2023. The AI tech giants tried to adjust their models to respect diversity more. However, the results of these adjustments had unintended consequences.

articles.title: Humane AI Pin: The most mocked technology release of recent years is dead
articles.author: Andrew Griffin
articles.summary: Humane AI Pin is no longer supported or sold. Some of the company's assets will be sold to HP. The online services will shut down at the end of the month. The pin cost $699 and customers had to sign up for a $24 per month data plan.

articles.title: Will We Squander the AI Opportunity?
articles.author: Daron Acemoglu
articles.summary: At the recent AI Action Summit in Paris, many discussions emphasized the need to steer AI in a more socially beneficial direction. For more than 200,000 years, humans have built solutions to the challenges they face and shared their knowledge with each other. AI could invigorate this trend by complementing human skills, talents, and knowledge, improving our decision-making, experimentation, and applications of useful knowledge.

articles.title: Lawsuit alleging UnitedHealthcare used faulty AI to deny coverage advances in federal court
articles.author: Christopher Snowbeck
articles.summary: A federal judge in Minneapolis has ruled portions of a patient lawsuit can move forward. Plaintiffs allege UnitedHealthcare used an artificial intelligence tool called naviHealth to cut off coverage of rehabilitation care after they were hospitalized. The company insists its coverage decisions are made by medical directors and not by artificial intelligence.

articles.title: What is QuillBot? Everything we know about the AI writing assistant
articles.author: Max Slater-Robins
articles.summary: QuillBot is an AI-powered writing assistant designed to help users paraphrase, summarize, and refine their writing. It was developed to assist with content creation, academic writing, and general text enhancement. QuillBot offers various writing modes, including Standard, Fluency, Formal, and Creative. It's available as a web-based platform and offers browser extensions for Chrome and Edge. The premium plan costs $49.95 per year.

articles.title: Google AI Overviews now showing on more Google Lens results
articles.author: Barry Schwartz
articles.summary: Google is expanding AI Overviews to show on more Google Lens results. Google is also adding to its Chrome app and Google app for iOS a new Lens feature that lets you select and search whatever's on your screen with just a simple gesture. With the AI overviews using Lens for a page you are viewing, this may lead to people viewing your website and then using this feature.

articles.title: Google Chrome is adding a Circle to Search-like feature for iPhones
articles.author: Jess Weatherbed
articles.summary: Google is rolling out new search gestures for iPhone users to highlight anything on their screen to quickly search for it. The Lens screen-searching feature is available on iOS in both the Google app and Chrome browser. It's similar to Android's Circle to Search, which isn't supported on iPhones.

articles.title: Sanas taps AI to change call center workers' accents in real time
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Maxim Serebryakov, Shawn Zhang and Andrés Soderi founded Sanas in 2020. The company uses AI to adjust a speaker's accent in real-time. It was inspired by Raul's experience working in a call center. Sharath Keshava Narayana, who previously co-founded call center startup Observe.ai, joined Sanas.

articles.title: Letter: You're being axed by cold calculations
